body: Expectation is that rclone does not generate ERROR log entries for default behaviour when passed well-formed config files.

issue.title: plugins: Create plugins files only if webui is enabled.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

<!--
Describe the changes here
-->

Create plugins related files only if webui is enabled.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->
#4600  #4592 

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
here the same
```
2020/09/21 22:19:16 ERROR : error reading available plugins: Error creating : /root/.cache/rclone/webgui/plugins/config
```
docker based rclone install 
bash-5.0# rclone --version
rclone v1.53.1
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.15

installed as root per Docker Image
rclone commands running as abc UID 1000 User
Any workaround this before it gets merged? Thanks.
Anyone got a working work around?
I downgraded to 1.50.2 on docker and it's okay now

> I downgraded to 1.50.2 on docker and it's okay now

okay, we can use this for the moment. It work
```yaml
version: "3.7"
services:
  rclone:
    container_name: rclone
    image: rclone/rclone:1.50.2
    network_mode: host
    user: "${PUID}:${PGID}"
    volumes:
      - ./docker/config/rclone:/config/rclone
      - ./docker/data/rclone:/data:shared
      - ./docker/data/cache/rclone:/var/cache/rclone:shared
      - /etc/passwd:/etc/passwd:ro
      - /etc/group:/etc/group:ro
    command: "mount gcrypt: /data/mount --allow-non-empty --dir-cache-time 1000h --poll-interval 15s --umask 002 --cache-dir=/var/cache/rclone --vfs-cache-mode full --vfs-cache-max-size 320G --vfs-cache-max-age 336h --rc --rc-web-gui --rc-user=${RC_USER} --rc-pass=${RC_PASS} --rc-addr :5572"
    devices:
      - /dev/fuse
    cap_add:
      - SYS_ADMIN
    security_opt:
      - apparmor:unconfined
    restart: unless-stopped
```

issue.title: issue_118 added mkdir to Dockerfile and simplified rclone_setup.sh
